https://prez.dev/description.@value: This vocabulary lists the fundamental types of geological features that are used to define the geological framework/4D evolution of Western Australia and are relevant to the duties of the Geological Survey of Western Australia. A geological feature is a physical or conceptual feature that is hypothesized to exist coherently in the Earth and that results from geological processes (definition largely derived from SWEET ontology http://sweetontology.net/realmGeol#geologicfeature).

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Stratigraphic and lithodemic units that are formally defined and named in the Australian Stratigraphic Units Database (https://www.ga.gov.au/data-pubs/datastandards/reference-databases/stratigraphic-units) following conventions set out in the International Stratigraphic Guide (Salvador, 1994; an abridged version of the guide is available at https://stratigraphy.org/guide/index.html).

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: One of the foundation elements in GSWA's Explanatory Notes System, used to define the geological framework of an area.

https://prez.dev/description.@value: Stratigraphic and lithodemic units that are formally defined and named in the Australian Stratigraphic Units Database (https://www.ga.gov.au/data-pubs/datastandards/reference-databases/stratigraphic-units) following conventions set out in the International Stratigraphic Guide (Salvador, 1994; an abridged version of the guide is available at https://stratigraphy.org/guide/index.html).
